channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Plan to Save Frank Lloyd Wright’s Only Skyscraper Isn’t Going as Planned
item.description: Less than two years ago, the building was thought to have been rescued from financial woes. Now the new owners have it on the auction block and some W...

item.title: China’s beleaguered real estate shares jump almost 10% after Beijing makes its ‘strongest housing pledge to date’
item.description: Investors gave China's stock markets their best week in years after Beijing promised more stimulus measures to support the economy.

item.title: Hybrid work boosts pay for all, study finds, debunking employer myth of inequality
item.description: A new equilibrium in the hybrid work space means in-office workers are getting pay bumps while remote workers enjoyed other benefits.

item.title: Facing a Big Test, Iran’s ‘Axis of Resistance’ Flails
item.description: Iran united militias to take on Israel, but as the Israelis pummel one, Hezbollah, the rest have so far largely failed to come to its aid.

item.title: California governor signs 2 bills to protect children from AI-generated deepfake sexual images
item.description: Current law does not allow district attorneys to go after people who possess or distribute AI-generated child sexual abuse images if they cannot prove...

item.title: A Transformative Leader Steps Down in Mexico. What Will His Legacy Be?
item.description: President Andrés Manuel López Obrador lifted millions out of poverty while eroding democratic norms, allowing his nationalist political movement to ex...

item.title: Dockworkers Strike at U.S. Ports Could Begin Tuesday
item.description: Members of the International Longshoremen’s Association could walk off the job, halting most shipments at East and Gulf Coast ports and rattling the U...

item.title: N.Y.C. Tap Water May Taste Different During Upcoming Tunnel Shutdown
item.description: The city has famously delicious drinking water. Forced repairs to the Delaware Aqueduct may lessen its quality.

item.title: Dockworkers Strike at U.S. Ports Could Begin Tuesday
item.description: Members of the International Longshoremen’s Association could walk off the job, halting most shipments at East and Gulf Coast ports and rattling the U...

item.title: Israel Strikes Houthis in Yemen, and Helene’s Trail of Destruction
item.description: Plus, the plain-spoken poetry of Kris Kristofferson.

item.title: Rightmove calls for ‘best and final’ offer after rejecting third Murdoch bid of £6.2 billion
item.description: After Rightmove's latest rejection, Rupert Murdoch's REA faces a U.K. takeover deadline later today.

item.title: The Stakes on Abortion
item.description: We explain where Kamala Harris and Donald Trump stand on the issue.

item.title: Senior Officer Gets 3 Years Over South Korea Crowd Crush
item.description: Lee Im-jae, a former district chief, is the most senior official to be convicted in connection with the 2022 disaster that killed nearly 160 Halloween...

item.title: Fortnite-maker Epic Games is suing Google and Samsung, accusing them of colluding to keep its app store out
item.description: Epic said that in July 2024, Samsung changed Auto Blocker from an "opt-in" feature to the default setting, forcing users to navigate a cumbersome 21-s...

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Says It Killed Hamas’s Leader in Lebanon
item.description: An airstrike killed the Hamas official and family members in a refugee camp for Palestinians, the group said. A separate deadly blast in Beirut damage...
